Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the overturn record of the Ninth Circuit, stating it is "close to 80%".
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the Ninth Circuit has an overturn record close to 80%.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that a high overturn record automatically implies a "terrible" or "messy" system.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided, stating that the 80% figure applies only to the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals and not the district courts.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the 9th Circuit's reversal rate is not the highest among the circuit courts.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the overturn rate, as it is higher than average but not the highest.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity and disputed nature of the cases that the Supreme Court chooses to take on, which could impact the overturn rate.
